evidences.description: fragment of a burned receipt, still visible a code #883-XC-99 and some indications written in Chinese

analysis.expert_report: Chemical analysis revealed traces of a highly specialized industrial accelerant. This suggests the arson was premeditated and not a simple accident.

evidences.description: Complete digital receipt with a list of purchased products: acetone, clock, peroxide in Chinese

analysis.expert_report: Forensic analysis of the video file reveals a mismatch between the internal Atom Metadata (ISO/IEC 14496-12) and the visual timestamp overlay. While the frame display shows 03:00 AM, the 'creation_time' encoded in the binary header is 05:45 AM. Additionally, the presence of inconsistent global motion vectors suggests frame injection. The footage has been artificially delayed to support a false timeline.

evidences.description: Glitch's technical report describing the discrepancy between the video's metadata and the date and time displayed in the video. The video has been tampered with.
A technical report from the telecom provider showing Li Jun's mobile device connected to a cell tower in North Hill at 03:00 AM, miles away from the Red Dragon Club.

analysis.expert_report: The logs are definitive. Li Jun's phone was pinging the North Hill tower during the exact window he claims to have been at the club. His alibi is physically impossible.
